alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clay; Fillmore; Franklin; Furnas; Hamilton; Harlan; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 22 at 2:34PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulation ranging from a dusting up to around 1 inch, and the highest amounts favoring counties west of Highway 281. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze, mainly before sunset. North to northwest winds gusting to around 35 MPH will result in at least patchy blowing snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as around 20 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although light snow will occur before then, the majority of accumulating snow is expected to happen between 8 PM and Midnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Clay; Fillmore; Franklin; Furnas; Hamilton; Harlan; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster; York
